attributes.action: For Kcom to allows other internet service providers into Kingston upon Hull.
attributes.additional_details: They are rolling out fibre into hull and have left the poorer areas having to wait over 2 years to get it installed. My area has Been put back a year. And from what I have heard the prices are ridiculous and come with a huge installation fee.
attributes.background: By kcom not allowing other internet providers into hull, they stop people from getting better broadband deals, better internet connections and also stop people getting tv and phone packages with company's such as sky and virgin. I run at 5GB download and pay £55 a month for phone and broadband.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. Kingston Communications is a private company and the UK Government and Parliament are not responsible for its operation or the operations of other service providers. 

You might be interested in this report from Ofcom, the UK's communications regulator:

https://www.ofcom.org.uk/consultations-and-statements/category-1/wholesale-local-broadband-access-market-reviews-hull
